com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.rmi.util

Class UnicastRemoteObjectWithStubMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.rmi.util.UnicastRemoteObjectWithStubMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Remote

    public class UnicastRemoteObjectWithStubMap
extends UnicastRemoteObject
    Use this as the base class of your RMI implementation objects if you need to be able to identify when a remote object (stub) passed to you in a remote method call actually refers to one of your local objects.

    This class keeps track of all your own stubs and recognizes them when they come back to you passed as parameters in remote method calls.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • stubToImpl

        public static Remote stubToImpl(Remote stub)
        Look up an implementation given a stub.
        Parameters:
        stub - Stub which has probably been received as the parameter in a remote method call.
        Returns:
        Implementation object if the given stub corresponds to one of my local objects. Returns null if the stub corresponds to a remote object in another JVM.
